number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												I'll be very simple with the review since it's not a game that you need to over-complicate or go too in-depth with the details of. Blockland is a lego-like sandbox game in which you can create and design any kind of world or server you could ever desire. The game can be compared to the sandbox "Garry's Mod", which also centers on a player-driven system.Like Garry's Mod, this game is somewhat of a niche, yet because of it's marketed open-endedness and scope, as well as low price and system requirements has been marketed to mass public. And like Garry's Mod, this is a game for specific people, and not the mass market.The community has been accused of being focuses of drama and controversy and the forum and game policing has said to be flimsy at best, but this is a community driven game, again, like Garry's Mod. And on top of that, this game was developed in a time period in which indie games struggled quite a bit to get on their feet. This combined with the rare lifespan that this game has exhibbited has picked up a lot of baggage over the years, just like anything would. And the high social learning curve that comes with this game isn't exactly friendly to new players. What I mean is that each server is maintained and controlled be either a board of admins that the host has chosen to moderate and maintain the server, or a singular admin. How that admin wants to host and represent that server is up to them. People who like the hosts ideals will likely drift towards the servers with those admins, making sub-cultures in the game world.The best thing for a new player to do is find a server with friendly new players and slowly intigrate into the community, otherwise you will most likely irritate the sometimes easily irritatable inhabitance of the game.All in all, coming from a "veteran" player that watched this game grow and grow over the years, I'd say that it is enjoyable, so long as you can find a server community that you can intigrate with, you will have no problem with the community. As for the game, it's a high customisable sandbox game. That's pretty much the depth of it.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2014
												A long, long time ago, in a galaxy far away, Eric "Badspot" Hartman casually experimented with the idea of making a lego-oriented game with the Torque Engine. You place lego bricks in a voxel world, drive brick cars, shoot weapons, destroy bricks with hammers, ski down slopes, etc... The kinds of things most kids like to imagine doing with legos.Today, the game has reached new heights compared to its early years. The creative side of Blockland has gone to new extremes with their endeavors. When you first enter the game, you might be disoriented at first. There is no direction; you just place and edit bricks, among other things. But stick around and explore, and the rewards will be greater every time. Build a house or other structure of your choice. Then build another; then another, and another. Improve your technique, and watch your skills improve as your builds become more elaborate and more detailed, realistic, and higher quality.Make the bricks do things with the Wrench Event system, whereupon you might begin crafting brick-event computers and contraptions, sci fi setups, RP games, and countless other possibilities yet to be explored...Explore online servers and see what the other players are doing; of all the things you might find, locally famous examples include: A 1:1 scale exact detail replica of the RMS Titanic, giant six-story spaceships, high-detailed yachts, realistic houses both vintage and modernesque, science labs, roleplay worlds, giant dragonflies, arenas, etc...  you'll find many visual examples of Blockland creations through this link: http://forum.blockland.us/index.php?topic=247866.0, the Blockland trailor, and of course on online servers.The game's add-on system is among the most prominent features of the game. You might consider searching out and downloading custom bricks, vehicles, tools, gamemodes, events, etc as well to enhance your potential. Most add-ons may be found in the Add-ons section of the Blockland forums.In all, this game will be well worth the money if you stick around and explore the possibilities. The game's path is yours.-----PS: Before you step in, beware: The Blockland community is, in general, exceptionally... er... badly influenced. There are nice people out there, but it is advised that you use your own judgement to find them, and beware that dwelling too long in the general sea of the Blockland Forum and many Blockland internet servers, your sanity may be at risk. I urge you not to let this effect your impression of the game itself.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2014
												I tried a demo for the game years ago, and had a bunch of fun with so little. Now I have the full game, and the possibilities are pretty much limitless. There is so much to do and/or create with Blockland. If you had a passion for Legos as a child, you might enjoy this game... a lot. It has the building mechanics of Legos, with the gameplay and versatility of Garry's Mod. The only setback for this game's potential is the community. There are always good people, but the majority seem to be pretty immature, but it's kind of expected for the type of game. Overall, I think it's a great game to have. It's very fun to play with friends! Also, feel free to check out my basketball server if you decide to buy.

												Very fun game. Reminiscent of the Lego bricks you've once known and loved combined with an edge that makes you think the Garry's Mod development teams had something to do with it. A good time killer, and something fun to play with a group of friends. Something also to note is that the community can usually be pretty helpful as well as friendly. Other times, they can be kind of turdish, but hey, all games have their nipple-twisters. The thing I like most about the game is that the building and "scripting" is very straight forward, making it easy to do what you really want to do with the game. Let your creative mind run wild.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												Ah this is such a great game. I've had this game for over 5 years and put in over 1000 hours into it before it came to steam, it's the best sandbox game I've ever played because there is just so much you can do. I may have been just a kid when I first bought this game, but it is still amazing, I would reccommend this game over Garry's Mod because of it's great build system, gamemodes, and events system, which allows you to manipulate items and do amazing things. For a simple example, if you use events on a block, you could make it so that by touching the block you go flying into the air with your butt on fire. There are numerous possibilities with this game, it's simeoultaneously a FPS shooter, a 3rd Person Shooter, a racing simulator, a Dogfight simulator, a Quake-Like Deathmatch arena, a City RPG, a Jail RPG, and anything you can possibily think of. This is all thanks to the numerous enjoyable addons created by the community such as different gamemodes and addons. Very very underrated for it's quality as a game. People try to compare this game Roblox and then subsequently judge it based on that terrible game, but this should not be the case, because first of all it was created long before Roblox, second it has a much better community, third it has a much better building system, and fourth it has much more possibilities in terms of addons, gamemodes, and maps.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2015
												Blockland Is a great game. It's a virtual sandbox that combines the community mods of Gmod with the building style found in LEGO brick along with some decent lighting! The thing is, our community is dying. We need numbers (players)  now more than ever to bring this game out of an unfotunately impending demise. I paid for this game back when it was 20 US dollars, and even at that price, I believed my money was well spent. Thsi game has given me some  good experiences and great friends over the 4 years I have played it. I can't possibly recommend it enough. We just need more players to bring fresh, creative ideas back to the game. If you're still uncomfortable to pay the 10 US dollars, just wait for a sale, then the purchase will definitely be worth it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												I'll be very simple with the review since it's not a game that you need to over-complicate or go too in-depth with the details of. Blockland is a lego-like sandbox game in which you can create and design any kind of world or server you could ever desire. The game can be compared to the sandbox "Garry's Mod", which also centers on a player-driven system.Like Garry's Mod, this game is somewhat of a niche, yet because of it's marketed open-endedness and scope, as well as low price and system requirements has been marketed to mass public. And like Garry's Mod, this is a game for specific people, and not the mass market.The community has been accused of being focuses of drama and controversy and the forum and game policing has said to be flimsy at best, but this is a community driven game, again, like Garry's Mod. And on top of that, this game was developed in a time period in which indie games struggled quite a bit to get on their feet. This combined with the rare lifespan that this game has exhibbited has picked up a lot of baggage over the years, just like anything would. And the high social learning curve that comes with this game isn't exactly friendly to new players. What I mean is that each server is maintained and controlled be either a board of admins that the host has chosen to moderate and maintain the server, or a singular admin. How that admin wants to host and represent that server is up to them. People who like the hosts ideals will likely drift towards the servers with those admins, making sub-cultures in the game world.The best thing for a new player to do is find a server with friendly new players and slowly intigrate into the community, otherwise you will most likely irritate the sometimes easily irritatable inhabitance of the game.All in all, coming from a "veteran" player that watched this game grow and grow over the years, I'd say that it is enjoyable, so long as you can find a server community that you can intigrate with, you will have no problem with the community. As for the game, it's a high customisable sandbox game. That's pretty much the depth of it.

												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 16, 2015
												Create your own buildings using bricks.Engage in multiplayer battles that take place in a vivid block world.Interact with gamers all over the globe and compete or cooperate.Block games have received quite a lot of popularity since Minecraft appeared 5 years ago. The market is actually invaded by a lot of games that look like similar just to capitalize on its success, but in order to be successful in the gaming world you do need to be innovative, and that’s what Blockland tries to deliver. This is basically a game where you can use bricks to create the game world in any way imaginable.Since Blockland is an online game at heart, you will have to rely on other people to create the game world how you want, or each player can create its own region and defend it against the attackers.There are also some situations or game modes in which you won’t build anything, since the world is already built. Instead, you will have the opportunity to explore the world and defeat the other persons you encounter, while also avoiding zombies and other NPC creatures. The possibilities really are endless in this game and most of the time the people that play it will choose what to do and where to go, since there are literally no restrictions whatsoever, and that is truly important.While the buildings in Blockland don’t seem to be affected by gravity or physics, you do have the option and tools to create a world that is very realistic and unique.The controls in the game are very solid and they give you a great feeling and appeal, which is surely important. Furthermore, you also have a lot of multiplayer systems into the game, including a player hosted server system which allows players to develop their own world and invite their friends to play.Bricks can be created for a certain event or programmed and there’s even a unique add-on system that really makes the game shine. The community for this particular title is rather large, much larger than you would expect and, of course, there are some situations in which you are not welcome to the server.Even so, with the help of the forum and numerous other additions, Blockland does offer a lot of ways to communicate, including the in-game chat. This makes the game a very good one for kids that want to be creative and come up with something of their own.Blockland is the crowning achievement of the block game mania, as it delivers all the tools needed by the gamers to create their own worlds out of blocks. Yes, it will surely eat up a lot of your time, but in the end the game is well worth your time, since it has so many features and things you can do in it. Replayability is at its best here and it’s guaranteed that no two sessions will be the same. It’s surely much more than you could hope for, and we certainly recommend it to anyone who has an interest in block building games.

												The community is what you make it, development has been in a slump recently but this game is complete and has provided a lot of replayability and room for creativity for me and a lot of the friends I made on this game (note I have few hours on steam version but likely a few hundred before I got it on Steam). Many of the negative reviews are people complaining about the developer not consistently putting out free updates consistently even for years after release, despite a strong modding community, and these people also tend to be problem users that stir up drama with developers are other players on the forum. This game IS definitely worth it, and I dare someone to tell me why its not. There is some cruddy servers but there is also the occasionally great server, just like most sandbox multiplayer games. If you're remotely interested in a lego based sandbox building game, get this game.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 14, 2015
												I've spent hours upon hours building everything from boats to castles to spaceships, and playing games with other people online, most likely making Blockland my second-most-played game of all time. This was a long, long time before the game appeared on Steam, however, so you'll just have to take my word for it. I have yet to find another sandbox building game that gives you the level of freedom that Blockland does, with an endless supply of user-created add-ons in the form of blocks, game-modes, and more. LEGO sets were one of my favorite toys as a child, so being able to not only have endless bricks to build with but also the ability to explore my creations up-close as a small minifigure and interact with them was a dream come true.While some people will use their imagination to bring physical form to whatever they can think up, my forte was always recreating things from other media. Not the most creative thing in the world, but it was the most enjoyable for me. At various points I worked on reconstructing playable versions of Team Fortress 2's ctf_2fort, Pokemon's Kanto region, and the entirety of Portal, as well as a large-scale model of Halo's Rocket Launcher. My only regret is that I'm not very good at finishing what I've started, as the Rocket Launcher was the only thing that ever reached total completion.Most people tend to complain about the userbase, but it's only as bad as any other place composed mostly of people in grade-school who haven't been a part of an online community before. Certain problematic users will insist this game is bad, but only because they've been punished for misbehaving time after time after time. Overall, it just takes time to adjust.

Posted: December 16, 2013
												I first discovered Blockland in 2009, and I fell in love with it. Combining my hours on and off of Steam I have accumulated some 2.4 thousand hours of gameplay. The building system is complex as hell, and if you're not good with Legos then this really isn't for you. The game's fanbase has largely died out due to the death of RTB and maps (just go on the Blockland forums and look at old gallery topics or soemthing). Most of the servers that other people have started are cancer.I think my point is that if you can have fun on your own, making your own games, building your own maps, hosting your own original servers, this is the game for you. If you've come because you want to♥♥♥♥♥♥around in prebaked maps and have laughs, search elsewhere.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2014
												Five years of Blockland (3 years of activity):I've been playing Blockland since some of earlier days, starting in v10.  Over the whole course of that time, I've been a fairly active user.  From the time I joined in 2008 until April 2009, I was learning the ropes, how to behave, proper etiquette, etc.  In April, Blockland was un-installed when I was grounded, and I slipped away from it.  In early 2012, after several half-hearted attempts to get it back, I got it working again.  I've made a fool of myself on many occasions, but I've contributed in many ways too, mostly to in-game servers.  Blockland is definitely one of the best games I have ever played/owned in my life.Note to new Steam users: I've noticed that a lot of people have probably discriminated against you for being new.  Please don't be discouraged by this.  The majority of our community is not like that, and is more than willing to help you with anything you might need.  One of the best ways to cut the discrimination is to change your name.  You start with a default name where (*) are the ID numbers (Blockhead*****).  At the bottom of the title screen, hit the button saying 'Name' and enter any name of your choosing (assuming that it is available).- XR_7 (50690)

content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
												This is a really good sandbox game! It's flexible (not as flexible as ROBLOX, though), and it's quite easy to set up certain game-modes. There's a large add-on archive which has lots of things that'll appeal to you. You can create your own add-on with some scripting knowledge (lua, I believe), and a graphics software such as Blender. It can range from new zombie types to guns, to vehicles, to items like Night Vision goggles!There's only one real issue that I may have noticed. The developer can be quite rude at times (sources are from the reviews + screenshots), and that the game really isn't updated often anymore. You don't really need updates to enjoy the game, though! Add-ons serve a large purpose.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												EDIT 2: ♥♥♥♥ my reviews just look at my hoursOriginal:It may just look like a game where you just place bricks. Its alot more than that.This game opens alot of opportunites. You go on, click the join game button and see a list of at least 20 servers. Theres always plently of servers open. Prision Escape, Fort Wars, FreeBuild, CTF, Diesease, Murder Mystrey, Bot Wars, Role-play severs, Speedkart and Deathrace are all good examples. Some are modded, some arent. Another good part of the game is the mods are automatically downloaded.Edited in for popular demand: Minigames and eventing are amazing. Start up a mini game and make it the way you want. Turn the mini game to a capture the flag ot even a City RPG.Eventing is even better. Event a brick so when you click on it, it plays a song or even tells you something. Make hidden rooms with disappering bricks, Make your bots look like you, Make traps so people fly into the air and so much more that i cant remember.Sadly, on mac, It is a bit glitchy. You cant see any faces, when you start up the game it asks you to setup your settings and your player always resets.Singleplayer is mostly good for nothing, unless you have some fun mods or you just want to mess around with bots or something.It is still the funnest game ive ever played in history of games ive played. EDIT: e.g. ive played 200 hours of it. (and none of my other games have come close to that.)Mods are hard to get, there are some websites that have archives of the epic website, RTB. (that is closed) In all its such a fun game, but there are a few sad reasons of not to get it. I'd reccomend it to people that like: sandbox, building, fps, loling, role-playing, zombies and tf2 like games!!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												Blockland may look like a Minecraft or Roblox clone at first glance to some people,but it really isn't and it in itself is much more than that. So BL is a building game first made in 2004 in the V0002 state, the retail version was then released in 2007 with the latest version being V21. Have you've ever played with LEGO's as a kid or built something with them? Did you ever have fun with them? If yes, then Blockland is the game for you. The game allows you to build with a virtually unlimted amount of bricks (There's a 256,000 brick limt,but you can set your own limt on your own server). It also even features an in-game eventing system that allows you to do cool stuff with your bricks like make a door that open and closes or a light switch. The modding community is also pretty good with a good number of brick packs, vehicles, colorsets, music, and etc. The community itself isn't the best, but there really isn't a perfect community out there anyway. You may meet some bad players here and there,but if you stay away from the bad side of the community you'll be fine. The graphics are very blocky and legolike giving a very nice look especially for a old 2003 engine.There are shaders in the game,but they look very jaggy and bad and they're also very poorly optimized at it too.If you want to there are modifications that can help you make the shadows look smoother,but you'll need a great PC to get it done. I would really recomend this game to anybody if you like building games and don't worry you'll really get your money's worth, I've spent at least about 400hrs (With my old blid and steam blid combined) on the game and haven't stopped yet.Note: When you first get the game I would highly recommend getting RTB.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												Based on a (somewhat true) story.Once upon a time,there was a blockhead called Toastee,he looked like a zombie wearing a grey sweater and beanie. He went on a cityRP and he dressed like a normal person,i decided to go raiding houses. An adming saw what i was doing and instantly gave the job of Criminal to me.Thats when operation 'Food Corner' was in process. I invited some friends and told them to do what i do. I got enought money to get a gun. So instead of sneaking into houses,i rang the doorbell and pointed a gun at a guy while everyone else took stuff. We would all share.Until "BERRIES" decided to take my cut.I then decided to Akimbo him in the face and take his cut. Yay.He then lived a normal life since. I robbed him often with my friends "Whip Crem" and "Buttr" as we enjoyed eating the pizza he never bought for us.Then Buttr decided to join the PD and grab a gun. We killed him on the spot.Whip Crem decided to lay low,so it was just me for 5 ingame days.I robbed Buttr and BERRIES for the whole 5 days,once a day each.Whip crem then went into my house with a Rocket launcher an admin gave him.I shot him on spot,got banned for 1 minute.Came back with all data saved,except for...My house!I went and got another friend (Stan Marshmellow) to hack this popstand admin known only as "Goodspot",most likely a fan of Badspot,the creator of Blockland.Problem solved.Or so we thought.Stan Marshmellow didn't know that Goodspot was a friend of Badspot. He was gone too.0 Friends,10 armoured cars,50 boxes of pizza. 10,000,000 Ingame dollars.Good trade.

Posted: January 23, 2014
												I have played Blockland for years now, experiencing many good and bad times. To be very honest, I had loved Blockland so much before steam and the version 21 (if you know what version I am talking about, the one that has removed maps). It might not be because of steam nor version 21, but this game was my teenagehood and I still play it. This game would be my all time, top 5 favorite games of all time because this game is not a competetive game if you do not want it to be. You choose whatever you want to do, whenever you want, experiencing it with friends online or just play on your own time to yourself. You can add many interesting toold, features, decals, and more to spice up your games' features. You can add these weapons and tools made by your fellow community from the forums or ingame with the rtb client. Anyways, this game would strongly be recommended by me as this game makes me feel like I am not only building with legos, but creating the creations I have dreamt of since I was young.

												I have had Blockland for the pat 5 years since v12. People will tell you the problem with this is the building system and truthfully you just need to get use to numb pad. Its the 3rd part in learning how to plant bricks in the tutorial where you put it in the small hole (that's what she said hehe) but really mastering numb pad is key to building and in-fact, makes it easier than most games since if you miss you can just press a button to move it in place. number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												This game is disliked for one reason: because it is compared to Minecraft and Roblox, two very popular building games. Now, comparing this game to Minecraft is like comparing cows to pigs. It really doesn't make sense except for them being in the same category of game genres. I can see how you would compare this game to Roblox, but even then there are a LOT of differences. Roblox might be better in a way that you can have groups, dress easily, and what you can do on Roblox is limitless. But, Blockland is also limitless. One of the good parts about Blockland, is that it was entirely built by the community and everybody who has it has loved it. Yeah, it will continue having updates, but those updates won't change how fun Blockland is and it's style of gameplay. Hell, who cares if Blockland doesn't have groups, you can make your own that is based on Roleplaying, military, and so on. The skin designer is really easy to use and you can make some awesome decals for your shirt, pants, head, and everywhere. I recommend Blockland to anyone at the price it is at, because in my opinion, it is one hell of a game.

												I received a low-threat prisoner, so I didn't pay much attention to him. How wrong I was..It was a normal, average day. The prisoners were eating their lunch.. then it happened.He attacked from the shadows.Prisoner "Leeroy jenkins" viciously started stabbing my guards with his plastic fork. It was 5 against one.He'll never win, I thought.He'll never escape, I thought.He'll never survive, I thought.I thought wrong.He managed to start a full-scale riot, him and his army of offenders. They broke all 7 of my steel doors with their bare fists, escaping into the yard. They were almost out. I quickly hired God-knows-how-many dog handlers, in a valiant effort to hold them back until the authorities get here. I managed to keep the tsunami of prisoners back, put the prison on lockdown and finally the armed police got here.I did it, I stopped the riot.But then I saw that one particular cell was empty. Then I realized..LEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEROOOOOOOOOOOY JEEEENKINS!54/11 would plastic fork again.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
												yeah its funEDIT:I've played this game for a while, and I've decided to revisit it after not playing it for a while, and it made me realize how awesome it is. The first thing I'd like to express is that this is not Minecraft, and it is not Roblox. It is different from those. This is a completely different game. You can build actual lego builds using this, and it has a friendly "eventing system", which is essentially programming, which lets you bring interactivity to your buildings.  I think this is a good game, it has a generally nice community, and it has a range of servers for you to choose from. There are also quite a few mods in the game, and new mods are developed pretty often. I definately reccomend it if you enjoy sandbox or building type games.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
												Blockland is one of those games where it is what you make of it. There is no floor, and no ceiling for how good this game is, and how good it can be. I've had this game for about ten years now, and have played it for at least a month each year, and plenty more inbetween, although it has grown old for me now, it will always be my first and most favorite sandbox game of all time, with an add-on system rivaled only by Garry's mod you can't really go wrong with it.Despite having a rather toxic community that ressemble that of LoL and Dota, it actually has a very friendly add-on sharing community, where people often take requests and listen to feedback. The servers range from absolute♥♥♥♥♥♥to games within games, showing how diverse, yet repetitive a game can be, and having such a robust building system it opens a gateway to many, if not infinite, ways of producing content for yourself and the community.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
												Woah... I gotta say, this is actually quite a fun sandbox game. This game may look cheesy, but hey it's actually not that bad... At first I thought "Meh, I might give the game a meh rating" but after I played it..... it was actually quite fun.Having to be able to build anything whatever you freaking want with blocks that look like legos..... Sure! Why not?Although, there are 2 downsides to the game. One, is that some of the controls feel a bit akward. (The good side though is that you do get used to it after awhile. Still, it feels werid to me atleast.) Second, the graphics don't look... all that great (even if you have the shaders on MAX.)Overall, this is a really fun sandbox game and I highly recommend it. Even though some of the controls are a bit akward and the graphics aren't that good. It's still a good game. And if you have any friends on here, it's a great mutliplayer experince. Their is also other gamemodes as well. Such as SpeedKarts, Deathmatch, and so on. So if you don't wanna be sandboxing all day you could just play those as well. Good game, fun experince. I hope you all and to my friends will enjoy it! ^-^8/10

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 4, 2014
												This pains me to even type up such a review, becuase I've played Blockland way back in 2008, along with Roblox, which used to be my crack. While Roblox is now a slot machine, it still maintains to update itself in such a fashion. Its now more sleek and modern that Blockland here, and that normally wouldn't be a problem, but the problem is that this the year of 2014.I'm not saying that you can't release games like Shovel Knight, but from playing Blockland in 2008, to actually buying it on Steam in 2014, not a single damn thing has hardly been changed/updated. The only major updates have actually removed cult hit maps due to "incompatibilities". Guys, thats the equlivent of Garry completly removing construct from GMod... but again, it still wouldn't matter. Why? The whole reason why Blockland has failed: Community. You see, if Garry decided to remove famous content, the COMMUNITY would be like "Time to fire up some Source SDK" in  Blockland? Nope.To site an excellent review from DarkByte97;"The community for this game is virtually nonexistant (unless you're dying to be in a commuinty full of autocratic ♥♥♥♥♥). I have not seen a gaming community full of more hostile and irrational people in my life. This is why all of our servers have nothing good."Amen brother. Server after server, you'll meet some very arrogent people within the "community". Want to find some advice on subject matters that genuinely need answering? "Lol Roblox feg go frack urself lawl go suck Builderman's stud loL!!11!" The community sites Roblox as a terrible game, yet does nothing for their beloved game to actually help stand out against a superior platform for block building. What about Gameplay? Surely thats half-way decent... Building is... absolutley awful. Where you have a entire keyboard and mouse to use to construct your "uber amazing" projects, you use a numpad... its a awkard and seemingly unnecessary game mechanic to learn. Why can't I just simply right click to place a block? No, you HAVE to use the numpad, and if you don't, then you're too stupid. Again, age has been an absolute ♥♥♥♥♥ to this game, so clunky controls come with it.EDIT 1: You can rebind keys if you find the numpad off settingWhat about mods? Yeah, it supports them, and there are some good ones out there... on a site that shut down a couple of months ago. Yup. Awesome right? There are archives out there however, but still isn't as great as RTB.But hands down, the WORST part about Blockland is not the game itself, as old as it may be, but what surrounds it. The developer's complete ignorance and the communities lazy boy style of support, there's no water in Blocklands well, and its a damn shame becuase it has such amazing potential. I got lucky, I only bought this for a buck or two during the summer sale, but it was hardly worth that. If "Badspot" even decides to update Blockland with Steam Workshop, (he said he would, but that was a long time ago) maybe we'll see some cool stuff, and that the Steam community will do what the ocean did to Atlantis, and layer over the arrogent Blocktards, and shove some fire into Blockland's cold, dead heart.

Its now more sleek and modern that Blockland here, and that normally wouldn't be a problem, but the problem is that this the year of 2014.I'm not saying that you can't release games like Shovel Knight, but from playing Blockland in 2008, to actually buying it on Steam in 2014, not a single damn thing has hardly been changed/updated. The only major updates have actually removed cult hit maps due to "incompatibilities". Guys, thats the equlivent of Garry completly removing construct from GMod... but again, it still wouldn't matter. Why? The whole reason why Blockland has failed: Community. You see, if Garry decided to remove famous content, the COMMUNITY would be like "Time to fire up some Source SDK" in  Blockland? Nope.To site an excellent review from DarkByte97;"The community for this game is virtually nonexistant (unless you're dying to be in a commuinty full of autocratic ♥♥♥♥♥). I have not seen a gaming community full of more hostile and irrational people in my life. This is why all of our servers have nothing good."Amen brother. Server after server, you'll meet some very arrogent people within the "community". Want to find some advice on subject matters that genuinely need answering? "Lol Roblox feg go frack urself lawl go suck Builderman's stud loL!!11!" The community sites Roblox as a terrible game, yet does nothing for their beloved game to actually help stand out against a superior platform for block building. What about Gameplay? Surely thats half-way decent... Building is... absolutley awful. Where you have a entire keyboard and mouse to use to construct your "uber amazing" projects, you use a numpad... its a awkard and seemingly unnecessary game mechanic to learn. Why can't I just simply right click to place a block? No, you HAVE to use the numpad, and if you don't, then you're too stupid. Again, age has been an absolute ♥♥♥♥♥ to this game, so clunky controls come with it.EDIT 1: You can rebind keys if you find the numpad off settingWhat about mods? Yeah, it supports them, and there are some good ones out there... on a site that shut down a couple of months ago. Yup. Awesome right? There are archives out there however, but still isn't as great as RTB.But hands down, the WORST part about Blockland is not the game itself, as old as it may be, but what surrounds it. The developer's complete ignorance and the communities lazy boy style of support, there's no water in Blocklands well, and its a damn shame becuase it has such amazing potential. I got lucky, I only bought this for a buck or two during the summer sale, but it was hardly worth that. If "Badspot" even decides to update Blockland with Steam Workshop, (he said he would, but that was a long time ago) maybe we'll see some cool stuff, and that the Steam community will do what the ocean did to Atlantis, and layer over the arrogent Blocktards, and shove some fire into Blockland's cold, dead heart.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2016
												tl;dr don't touch this game with a 10 foot pole.To start- Personal Problems- Gameplay Problems- The ForumsBefore you readI cannot recommend this game. Before I start this off, I'd like to address the 1,000 hours thing. Most of my hours are from either from me leaving the game open for my friends (partially due to the fact that blockland on steam has no dedicated support, and lacking a client made me deal with doing this for a bit), dealing with my friends playing this game, or actually enjoying 1-2 gamemodes that are put out on the game that are pretty much non existent now. I have a love hate relationship with this game, you can make something done so well, working through the games pretty dated limitations, to be utterly destroyed by the community in any way possible, because if one problem is apparent, then everyone will try to exploit and break the system you've created. I mean sure that can go for everything, right? Well not like how the community treats it. You're the bad guy if the system is partially flawed, not the people actively trying to break your system. I have been on the fence of making this review for a good 6 months or so, mostly due to how I feel about the game and the community as said from above.Personal Problems inbound, Community TooOh, I know you! You're that jerk on the forum who hosted that one server!I don't think I want to host it ever again with how the community lashed out at me, it doesn't matter if I'm the victim at this point, here's my reasoning for why I say this: If you look at the previous works with my friends, I'm not involved, I'm not claiming to make everything, I'm trying to stay away from the spotlight because I outright don't deserve it. That's why I'm not the poster for these things, I'm not handling hosting an the event, and I'm not in charge of most of what's happening. I'm not in charge of any of this♥♥♥♥♥♥other than posting updates (which I didn't even do entirely), the formatting for threads, and music for our events. I don't want to pin the blame on others, because they don't deserve it, but this was outrageous. Now, during the event one of our events broke, spamming music. You know what we had to do? Restart the server. Oh, it's a tragedy, right? How dare we restart the server because something I HAD NO CONTROL OVER, broke. You know what happens then? a good 50+ people start collectively ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ on me when again, I HAD NO CONTROL OVER IT. I had blame pinned on me for no reason, and the community is downright ignorant.Oh, but you act like a prick!!I don't want to take part in the community for the most part anymore, if I ever go on the game again it's because of my friends motives, and anything I do towards the community I do if I really feel like it's needed. I'm not saying my actions back in the past are justified because I hate the image I made for myself, but if nobody is willing to give me even a chance to act like a competent person then why even try? If I come back under a different name, people will find who I am and continue ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ on me for something I did. It's not even worth my time, either. I don't want to deal with a community that actively attacks people in and outside of the community if they have a disability, I don't want associate with a community that acts this awful towards people, it's petty. I understand  I haven't been the best person around in the community, but even if I decided to change, nobody would give a♥♥♥♥♥♥ It's easier to act like a♥♥♥♥♥♥back unprovoked and act ignorant because that would get someone banned faster.If you hate the community, why have you been apart of it for so long?I have just outright tolerated it, but it has been the forum that has kept a lot of people towards the game for awhile, and getting off of it has been a hard time, but finally saying I don't want anything to do with that place anymore feels welcoming due to how awful the community can be sometimes. Toleration doesn't mean that I like it, though. I have just put up with the community, nothing more, nothing less until recently.Gameplay ProblemsWhat do you mean 1-2 gamemodes you've enjoyed? Wouldn't you recommend the game for that?I have 1,000 hours on this game, I've played a majority the game has to offer, and I'm not going to be the generic "the game isn't fun anymore" type of person. You have to actively sift through the♥♥♥♥♥♥on the master list to find games that are actually enjoyable, and a good 90% of the time there's nothing to offer. By the chance there is something fun to play, the community again attacks whatever me or my friends do because we're a group of like 6-7 people at a time. You know, because that many people is threatening and if we have power that one person has to constantly annoy us because they want to "join us" and mess everything up, and when they don't get their way they throw a ♥♥♥♥♥ fit and attack us whenever they can. This has happened so many times it's just outright ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I'm sick and tired of this happening constantly.What do you mean limited?The game came out like 10 years ago, the game is limited and has not had a big update in what, three years?! (3/13/17) What's there to play for? Nothing will be new and the community isn't treating the game that well either.One mistake? How so?The game is overall broken, there is so much broken to the point of where you can get out of maps that you have built. For example, you build something in a cube format, you can glitch and jump out through the walls and has never been fixed. You have to use zonebricks as a solution to this, and the downside to that? No water bricks. The game is also very very broken. If you sat down to play speedkart for an hour, I assure you that you have been shot away by the awful physics at least 5 times at a minimum. You have to work in the games awful limitations, and fix the games awful problems to manage to host one thing decent, mess up something or don't lock it down fully? Don't expect your server up for more than an hour.Oh, but you still enjoyed it!That doesn't mean I'll ever want others to play this game. Just because I have the patience to sit through and sift through god awful gamemodes is beyond the normal persons attention span.Deny it all you want, the community is declining. (Community plays a heavy role)Sorry to break it to everyone, but Blockland isn't what it used to be. I joined pretty late compared to others, but heck even in my time there were fun servers up with stuff to do. Now there's what, one or two (two if you're lucky) servers with over 20 people? It's hilarious. If you're playing it today and you're keeping your projects private/not releasing them, you're doing just as much as the people complaining about the game dying. Sorry to be blunt but that's the harsh truth.The ForumsThis is just going to be a small touch to this but, never join the forums. The forums are one of the worst places on the internet, never get involved with the people there.It's not a joke how bad the forums are.People are serious with how bad they are. Don't join to find out, just don't even go to the website. Stay as far away from it as possible. It is the epitome of a♥♥♥♥♥♥community.To conclude, I think the community does not play good service for the game, and I can tell you first hand that a good majority of the people in game are less than pleasant. Now that doesn't mean everyone is bad, there are some people that are actually worth talking to, but it's a minority.Edit 3/13/17: I split my problems between myself and the game itself, follow what you wish.

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
												If you enjoy playing with lego's, this is certainly a game for youBlockland is an non-linear lego-esque sandbox game with no goals or objectives. Instead, you start in an empty world with only your imagination. Players use bricks to construct anything they desire. Houses, castles, spaceships, anything you can think of. The only real limit is the brickcount, which i believe is around 1,000,000 bricks at once. Unless you're some hardcore extreme builder, you'll never hit this limit and you'll be free to build anything you want without worrying about running out of bricks(a common problem found with real life legos).If you don't like building alone, it's very easy to set up a server and have friends join the fun. You could even enter a public freebuild server and hangout there.Building not you're style? That's alright, this game has multiple gamemodes aka multiple ways of playing the game. Challenge some friends to a kart race, or join a deathmatch server and show off your mad MLG no-scoping skills. Team up with other players to defeat a powerful boss. Escape from prison while avoiding police brutality. Enter a city rp, empires rp, slave rp,or, everyone's favorite roleplay, the family rp. If none of that sounds interesting, you could always try to make your own gamemode and contribute to the community.Speaking of communtity content, the blockland forums is filled with countless amounts of add ons and new content to spice up your game. Download some new weapons, get a new car, fly a stunt plane. If you're a builder, there's tons of custom bricks and tools to make building easier and more fun.A lot of reviews here seem to warn you about the game's community to some extent. I'll be honest, there are some pretty bad people in the game, particlularly on the forums. However there are lots of cool people aswell to meet in game and on the forums, and that's not so bad.THE VERDICT:I spent $20 on this game before it's steam release, and probably have 500 hours on that version. Now it's only $10, so it's even more worth it. And when it goes on sale, you should have no reason not to buy this wonderful game.So, why are you reading this review and not buying/playing this game? Get it now, you won't regret it.

Posted: March 7, 2014
												This is marked as a negative for only a few reasons of that of which I'm going to explain. First off, I saw this game around its older and more golden years. I saw the mods, the weapons, the missions, the GUI features and the many things that the community were throwing in and everyone was loving it! I wanted Blockland. Badly. Unfortunately, I could not get it until its Steam release. But only now as I buy this, I find out that RTB is closing down and maps have been removed. This was a huge disappointment to me and those who wanted to play alone at their free will and explore and do missions that people would create. Now, don't get me wrong. This game is awesome and a ton of fun. But its strongest hole is the bad timing of things I wanted to try like everyone else around its golden age. Steam, I can only pray and hope that you will return a better community that are worthy to make the perfect addons. Again, this is much like the same issue Garry's mod had. When I saw Gmod, it looked amazing and fantastic. I played Gmod 12 and loved it all. That was when at the very cut second Gmod 13 was released and I lost that feature. Blockland....Please don't fail like Gmod did. Just do what everyone else wants. Addons and maps again. That is all I want. Other then that, this game is worth getting if you love to have a lot of freedom. But if you are one who has seen Blockland in its older ages before the steam release, you are likely better off waiting but if you want, its likely worth it to buy this anyways for the simple fact of its fun little multiplayer servers.

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												Preface: I've had this game since 2010 back in v16 and it has changed a LOT since then.  I've watched the community grow and change and I've probably spent several hundred hours on the game before it came to Steam.Blockland is a creative sandbox game created in 2004 by Badspot.  A lot of people say it's kind of like Lego Garry's Mod, which isn't far from the truth.  I love this game to pieces and always have, but it does have certain flaws that can seriously hinder the experience at times.The game is great because you can do nearly anything, but the community is a bit... strange, at times.  There are two groups of people in the game: the noobs that don't know how anything works, and the old-timers that are either very supportive of newcomers or are spiteful towards them.  There's not much middle ground between these groups and quite a lot of the veteran players have left the game since v21 was released, a few months before the game came to Steam.The biggest actual gameplay drawbacks will be very obvious within the first couple hours of playing: a bad physics engine and subpar graphics.  The physics engine has been buggy and unpredictable since the game's creation, although the graphics are actually substantially better now than before.Possibly the only thing that has really kept me playing the game this long is the giant amount of user-made content that can be found on the official forums.  The custom add-ons really bring the game to life and it's somewhat bland without them.  Nearly every popular server runs many add-ons, allowing for an even more custom and unique experience.Due to its Garry's Mod-like sandbox nature, Blockland has also inspired several notable video makers on YouTube, including Teneksi, Filipe1020, 8bitcube, Flubbman97, SirHerg1, and others.I'm trying not to be too wordy, so I'll just do pros and cons now cuz I'm boring like that.Pros:- Great building system allowing for near-endless creativity- Lots of great public servers to join- Huge catalog of mods and add-ons- Not difficult to set up a server (can be tricky sometimes if your internet is weird)- Community has lots of nice people that will help new players learn the game- Low priceCons:- Buggy physics- Average graphics- Controls can take a while to get used to- Not frequently updated (back in the day there was usually an update every couple weeks or so, but there hasn't been anything major since January 2014 as of this review)- Community has lots of trollsThe community is both a pro and a con because depending on who you meet, it could really go either way.Overall, I would say the game is definitely one of my favorite games of all time and even if you don't like it, it's only $10 USD spent.  That's really all there is to say about the game, and I hope you try it out!

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												First impressions after around 1 hour of gameplay:- The sound effects are awful. Either too low, or so loud that it gets completely distorted.- There is no music.- Most of the time, the game is silent. When it is not silent, there is some explosion or some loud sound.- The graphics don't look good. Specifically, the lighting effects and the particles look awful.- Building blocks is not as fun because it requires both clicking and using the keyboard numpad. Minecraft got it right, putting blocks in Minecraft is fun and intuitive. Putting blocks in Blockland is not.- The physics engine is weird and bad. I started up a new single-player kart racing game, drove for a few seconds, and accidentally hit a wall. The next second I was flying across the map.- Multiplayer kart racing is not fun. At one moment I'm driving, at the next moment I'm flying across the map because someone hit me.- Due to poor car handling, I have not managed to finish any kart racing. Neither in single-player, nor in multiplayer.- I don't know if it is triple-buffering or something else, but I feel there is some input lag in the game.- It has an achievement called "Gay Pirate". I guess the author thought it would have been funny, but it is not. In fact, it is completely out-of-place, and some people might view it as offensive.After 1 hour of gameplay, I'm wondering why I bought this game. Well, it was because it cost me 2 dollars. But now I wonder if I will ever play it again.Then I come back to Steam Community and look at the developer response to some reviews. I'm really starting to regret buying this game.Note: Using keyboard to place blocks can be very handy sometimes. However, requiring it all the time is not practical, as it means I need to move my hand away from WASD or from the mouse. Not fun.Note 2: At least the game has a borderless mode (besides the windowed mode and fullscreen mode).Note 3: The entire game has less than 100MB when installed.Bottom line: I had more fun exploring worlds of Second Life, playing the single-player survival mode of Minecraft, and building levels in Cube Engine and Sauerbraten.

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												I've had this game for many years even before it was on Steam, and I am overjoyed that it is now here. This game is worth it, and will be a long time before you get bored as long as you are imaginative and have friends to play with. Infact, I met most of my steam friends because of this game. The game has an "environment" system in which the textures for the skybox (skybox textures also will load their own lighting settings) and ground can be changed, a day and night cycle can be applied, water or lava can be added with customizability to the water level, as well as changes to the view distance and fog distance are possible. There are also a lot of Add-Ons for this game, which have impressive stability (Add-Ons are Found on These Forums: https://forum.blockland.us/index.php.) You can literally have 150 or more different Add-Ons made by different people, even some for older versions of Blockland, and they will continue to work with basically no problems at all. Try saying that for GMod where I can manage to have the game crash with less than 50 add-ons together.This game is certainly worth it however my only gripe with it is the lack of Linux support but even that is barely needed since it quite literally runs flawlessly on Linux using Wine versions 1.7 and up without a hickup ever.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												Blockland:+Graphics+The graphics are simple, and have lego-like textures for the studs. the lighting and particle effects are creative, and can change with hex values, so thats a space saver. The shaders, however, made the game less enjoyable, as the game shoves em down yer mouth. not alot of computers can run them.Graphics Overall: 7/10+Sound+Like the graphics, the sounds are quite simple. and using add-ons, they can be expanded and you can even create soundscapes (atmosphere sounds) with some add-ons. there are no Cons about the sounds, other then they are a little compressed.Sound Overall: 9/10+Community+As this game is about playing with your friends, it needs a good community. But, the owner just made the community go downhill after v2.0, he removed some maps that people loved (but they returned.... in 'brick' form.), he removed RTB support and the forum admins just spaz out if anyone even mentions this following sentance: "i hate this game." The sentance is simple, and its their opinion.Community Overall: 3/10+Overview+The game is good, but the support for the game just went downhill after V2.0There isn't much to talk about the game, its a building game, its about the community, but the game just doesn't have its old feeling.Other then that, i would recommend the game to a person who likes LEGOs and building, etc, but doesn't have a good computer to run Minecraft smoothly (since thats the game everyone talks about / never shuts up about, i really hate the minecraft fanboys, and they claim games that came out before that rubbish game all copy minecraft. e.g. Blockland, ROBLOX, etc.-+- Overall Score: 7/10 -+-

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												I have been playing this game since version 8--when there were only about 3000 players. I've loved this game and it's been basically the backbone of my internet career. You can literally do anything you want here--there are City RPGs, Freebuilds, Deathmatches, Mini Empires...all sorts of things. This is the LEGO game there never was. A multitude of mods make the game have the capability to host many different types of game modes that only need your brain to think up something good--there are even servers out there that you play on these floating platforms in the sky with only a grappling hook and a knife. The game used to have all sorts of terrain and buildings that you could play in, but with v28 those have been (sadly) removed. They were replaced with shaders which can really make the game look pretty, but if your computer can't handle them (most can handle them on medium at least), it's kind of a moot point. If you like playing building games with friends and want to get your creative juices flowing, get this game.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												Blockland was devloped by eric hartmen aka badspot.it was released as blockland 0002 in 2004, after a few years of devlopment it had a retail release in 2007.I bought this (or my dad bought it) for 20.00$ in 2012 and ended up playing this for 4 years. To me, this Blockland is kind-of underrated, I mean you don't see much videos on it. (even tho there is semi a lot of videos on it.) anyway The thing I like about blockland is that it was tons (and I mean TONS) of addons to download from the forums. (http://forum.blockland.us/index.php?board=34.0) Another thing is that there is ton of servers like boss battles, prison escape and many more. Now onething to note is that there used to be maps on blockland until v21 (the verson I joined Bl in) they replaced maps with shaders. as bad the shaders are. I am sick and tired of people ♥♥♥♥ing whining about how they "miss" the maps, like oh my god get over it. Anyway (again) I am not going to bore you about my "blockland story". Blockland's community ugh, NOW don't get me wrong there is some good people in said community, but holy crap, this is one of the worst commuity's you will ever see, I have got into so many agruements with people to the point where I hate the community now. and it's even worse in the on drama section in the forum.you'll see the cliche as ♥♥♥♥ "I am sorry","is blockland dying?" posts or a post about badmins and how bad a server is.and this is some quotes from badspot himself: "This is not a spam board.", "Bad things happening to you is not drama"and finally "If you don't care, don't post" and guess what?! People don't even read this. Ugh. Well thanks for reading my review. My rating on blockland is 10/10. Been playing it for 4 years, even if the community is garbage, I still love the game. Excuse my grammar isusses. Wait a ♥♥♥♥ing second? I barly reviewed the game, I just talk the about the game community for the most part. Well one community isn't one of the worst, it's still really bad. There is a lot of actually decent players in community like pecon7,visolator,sugar,kong123, myself,amir,badspot (Wait he is the creator) and many more and another thing great about said game is the eventing system. It's like the eventing system from rpg maker but defferent. Before v9 events were a add-on until in said verison (v9) it became hard-coded into. Players can things event via the Wrench (pre-install in the game). I am not going to say how events work in this review, but I will just say events have been used in great projects in blockland and there is many event addons and tutorials on how to event in BL and last thing to note on events, you can event bots. Lastly, building. Building in BL is pretty simple, there is a menu were you select bricks, spawns, bot spawns and many more. like with events, there is many tutorial on online on how to build stuff. Thats....my.....review. Now it ends here.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												highly recommend it. playing on your own on a server with strangers is alright but playing with friends is really where it's at. whether it's on a random server or your own private server you can do a lot. i'd also recommend getting plenty of add-ons and mods because the game is sort of bland without them. it gives you nice stuff to start with, but it gets old quickly. with add-ons the possibilities are pretty much endless, which makes it worth coming back to.often times the servers can be repetitive (roleplays, tdms, etc.) but every now and then you'll find a hidden gem that hasn't been seen before and can offer hours of fun. unless you want to wait around for those 'hidden gems', your best bet would be making your own server if you want a new experience.overall i think this game deserves more attention than it gets. some people just look at the bad servers and immediately dismiss it but you just need to find that one thing that gets you the most enjoyment out of the game. you just gotta look hard enough

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 26, 2016
												Blockland is awesome, It's a legendary building game where you build anything you want. The best of this game is shaders. The shaders are amazing. Textures, qualites, physics and more. Building can be hard at first, but. Once you get ust to it, you might build good builds in the future. Blockland is mainly about building. Building anything you want, from a house to a school! And there are many ways to build, some are fast but less efficent, some are slow but very efficent. Another important thing is combat. You can battle your friends or Bots in your map or in another server. Another thing is Socializing, most servers have E-Tard List filters, that prevent people from saying U or anything else. And chat spam protection, where if you talk too much, Blockland will block you only for a few matter of time. There is also a trust feature, where you can send Trust Invites to build on your friends or other people's builds. You can also make objects in your home, interact with them and more. Making them more detailed and beautiful. Blockland also haves mini-games, where you can use those to create short or long mini-games to battle your friends in your sandbox server.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2016
												Jesus has this been around for a long time...Blockland one the first games i've played on my first computer. It is a 3rd/1st person Block game with many different custom game modes to choose from and a very LARGE amount of customization that you can do to your character. This is one of the few games that when i heard went onto steam I HAD TO BUY.Pros:Billions of customization choicesVery large amounts of Custom gamemodesVery nice communityNo voice chat (Thank god)Saveable CostumesChoose your own nameFamily-FriendlyCons:The community is full of very small childrenThey removed the very old maps (Snow Mountains, Bedroom, and Mountains)There is no demo version on steamNo family-share (;-;)While I don't play it now as much as i use to. I really enjoy the game and i randomly play it from time to time. I really recommend this game for anyone who wants to have nostalga or just wants to play some custom gamemodes.

content:
Posted: March 22, 2014
												Blockland is a really good game. Badspot made something awesome here. I can start the game up and go on a server and have fun instantly. No matter the gamemode. Racing in carts is fun. Mining for hours just to get a good pickaxe is fun. Sniping other players is fun. The entire game is fun, heck, building pixel art of Mario and putting the fire emitters on it is cool to see. The whole concept of the game is really awesome. It's easy to mod, it's easy to have fun, and it's not expensive. I got the game for $2.49 while it was on sale and I wish I would have bought it for it's full price. Building in an online enviroment has never given me as much freedom as this game does. Think building with LEGO's online.The community here is outstanding. They practically make the game. There's tons of mods, tons of minigames, an acceptable amount of servers with nice, friendly people. Well, usually the people are friendly. There are some badmins out there and just plain rude people out there but it's the internet so thats not very surprising.The game isn't updated much anymore though, but oh well. What we have here is a cool little game you can have hours of fun on. Although it isn't as popular as it was before, Blockland stands out to me as one the funniest times I've had playing a game with friends and I'd recommend it to anyone who loves building stuff and letting their imagination flow.

The graphics are disgusting, the lighting is screwy, the community is increasingly toxic, and the physics are terrible. No game mode is absolutely worth it. I implore you, please do not buy this game. Loading into this game, you will immediately know you have lost money hopelessly. This game has exceedingly dumb and edgy game modes that are chalk full of agressive racists, sexists, homophobes, ableists, and just general scummy people trying to elicit a reaction from the populace. They all feel safe to openly discriminate and toss around slurs. It's like watching a trainwreck everytime this game is opened. It provides my friends and I a few minutes of entertainment, but I can tell you its really not worth it. You can get the same morbid entertainment from Roblox, and that's free so I'd say go there (or anywhere really) before this hell game.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												Great game, I loved playing it back in the day with maps and the great service known as RTB. However is recent years Badspot decided to remove the maps in exchange for enhance graphics and shaders. Despite the fact that I loved map, especially bedroom, it was a welcome change for me as I could now build on an unlimited scale. And, I've noticed some people say that there is stuff like a vehicle, bot, and a brick limit. Now this is mostly seen on the demo version of the game and these limits in the full version can be changed in the server settings before you start your server. Anyways, probably one of the best sandbox games I've ever seen, and I would love to see its community grow greatly. Who knows, maybe in years to come we might get RTB and maps added back into the game. Keep building and have fun!

content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
 The Hard Truth Listen up ladies and gents, here is the story. Blockland was a wonderful prosperous game. Great community and servers. The game was in its prime with maps and players everyone helping others build massive cities and gamemodes for all around to enjoy. Then v21 came out and took out these wonderful maps. Lots of players stopped joining these great servers and leaving the game altogether. There was still a lot of players left to build up from the rubble of this update. After a while the community slowly died. Then it hit, RTB shut down. This was the soul of the game, it held all the players' ideas and creations. Thus with this community website shutting down, it killed this game. Servers are barren, players are dazed and confused, creations dwindled. The game hit its peak then dropped harder than it should have. It's still a wonderful game it's just there are about a max population of 300 players on a day with about 90 or so servers up. About 30% of servers will have 0-2 players just sitting there, doing nothing.Story brought to you by loads of hours of offline steam play before it hit the greenlight. Still recommending this because it's still fun with a group of friends.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												All I can say is if you enjoyed legos when you were younger you'll love this. Whether you are dicking around building, having a deathmatch or racing in speed kart, the game is just pure fun. Some like to compare it to games such as Minecraft which I think is just silly, while the two may look similar they are nothing alike. The amount of user made content for this game is large enough to keep you occupied for quite a while and theres always something new to check out. My only complaints so far is the physics when it comes to speed kart, but even the wackyness of it can lead to some interesting races. I've also had the game crash on me quite a number of times and had errors logging into the servers to authenticate my game key (which I was lead to believe was Steams fault) Overall I give it a solid 7/10.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												=HEADS UP=I had a review before this one about the game being bad. This stays and is an Answer towards a user that truly loves this game and couldnt understand why i would downvote the game because my reasons were absolute ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t in his opinion.=INFO ABOUT THE REVIEW=1. My reviews tend to be a bit longer. If that is the case please be patient and read everything.2. This review is about my point of view and opinion. [If you disagree on a certain point or want to correct me: Be reasonable or i will ignore your comment.]3. If you want to try to change my opinion with arguments that make no sense in any way then please do not comment at all.=REVIEW=I will begin my review how i began it last time: Blockland, a game that looks nice and enjoyable.I have not played it for long since it didnt give me the chance. The reason for that will be displayed in detail below and just another heads up: If you dont like them deal with it and give my downvote a downvote. Or be reasonable and discuss it with me in a reasonable fashion.1. I saw this game and thought how amazing it would be to play it. I had it on my wishlist but other games took more of my time at that point so i didnt think of buying it. After a while a friend of mine by the name of DarquePanda bought it for me as a present. I was so happy and right away installed it. After it was downloaded i hoped into the tutorial and well it wasnt the best.2. The things i got in the tutorials were the basics of the game. The VERY basics. Building was explained shortly and mainly how you move the blocks. I mean it does explain you how to do certain things but if you dont want to play Twister on your keyboard with both hands on a mouse+keyboard game... But i didnt care much about that at this point in time since i wanted to play. So i tried to hop onto a server.3. I have waited a short amount of time and the game didnt response anymore. Nothing worked anymore. Not even Alt+F4 what made me cut off the power to my PC. After restarting PC and Game i tried making my own server since i just wanted to build something. And i pop up in a prebuilt world where i literaly could do nothing. I couldnt even look around. But this time Alt+F4 worked. And this made me uninstall the game again.The next part of the review is about something that happened to me after a while with a user and what i will also mention to clarify some of my points.After reading in a few reviews about how bad the community of this game is i most certainly can understand what they mean. After a long time with no problems with my review a user turned up and talked to me about one of my points in my downvote. I understood what he meant but still mentioned that doesnt interest me in terms of my  review since when a game doesnt work, it doesnt work.But instead of leaving it be he tried to make me look like an idiot and my arguments like♥♥♥♥♥♥ My first argument was the loading time, mentioned above as well, what he said is normal and i should be patient since he himself, with worse internet than mine as i read, had to wait a good amount of time just as well. I have played without mods. And my game bugged out so much that i had to restart my PC. That says everything doesnt it?To the next point of the controlls he said that you can rebind the controlls. A valid point if it wasnt for the fact that the game was made for MOUSE and KEYBOARD! And if you include the mouse into gameplay and you use wasd for the controlls you do not expect the user moving the hand off the mouse to use the other keys. The controlls for a game like this should be configured so you can use them without playing Twister on your Keyboard and that with both hands but they arent.There is a different game out there that is called Lego Worlds what is sort of similar to Blockland from what i saw except modding so far. And what can i say? From what i saw it is much better than Blockland can ever be. It not only looks better but also works much easier when looking at gameplay and hearing reviews about how the game and gameplay works in terms of controlls.I also want to mention the brilliant idea the good man that i am writing this review for. This might look to some a little bit to much but since this is a review about the game and people already mentioned the community i will also give an example of it. He had the brilliant idea of saying that before i could even write a review about this game i should atleast play it for 50 hours. Without that i should take down my review since it wouldnt be valid.And that has been it. I dont like the game. I dont want to play the game. I have already wasted time and space on my PC for it once and i refuse to do it again. And the worst is that i cant even refund this game even though i bought it BEFORE the refund update.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
												All I can say is if you enjoyed legos when you were younger you'll love this. Whether you are dicking around building, having a deathmatch or racing in speed kart, the game is just pure fun. Some like to compare it to games such as Minecraft which I think is just silly, while the two may look similar they are nothing alike. The amount of user made content for this game is large enough to keep you occupied for quite a while and theres always something new to check out. My only complaints so far is the physics when it comes to speed kart, but even the wackyness of it can lead to some interesting races. I've also had the game crash on me quite a number of times and had errors logging into the servers to authenticate my game key (which I was lead to believe was Steams fault) Overall I give it a solid 7/10.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
												Wow. Just wow. Coming from years of playing minecraft, I look back on my time spent and realize "What was I doing?" I could have been playing a vastly superior game. Now that I think about it, I should not call this a game. It's more of a work of art. Eric "Badspot" Hartman, the modern day Pablo Picasso and creator of this masterpiece obviously knows how to create new, fresh, original content, and not take the ideas of others and put them into a subpar game, in a genre controlled by a single giant game. Minecraft, on the other hand, attempts to rip off a game such as this, to a lesser quality. Does minecraft have a destruction engine? Nope, but this mona lisa of games does. Does minecraft have a working multiplayer? Hardly, but the sistine chapel of sandbox building games, Blockland, sure does. The only thing I can say in conclusion is that to all minecraft players looking for a better experience, look no further then Blockland.
