number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												This game is one of the best lego building games I have ever played. The game implements such great and innovative ideas that I can never go back to roblox or minecraft. There are no griefers online because of the games "trust" system. People can't build on your bricks unless you grant them trust (which you can give them through the player list GUI). There are two types of trust: the first type is build trust were people are allowed to build on your bricks, the second type is full trust were people are allowed to modify and delete your bricks. You can also demote someone's trust or take it away from them entirely so they can't build on your stuff.The administrative options are great as well. If someone spammed bricks all over your server you don't have to manually clean them up. Instead the admin GUI allows you to clear all the bricks of a specific user. You can also choose to spy on a person through the GUI to see if they are misbehaving. You can also load a save that you built before if you are an admin so you dont have to always build everything up on a server. There are also two different types of admins: admin and super admin. An ordinary admin can ban, admin orb (fly around and go through bricks) and load bricks. A super admin can do all that but it can also deadmin ordinary admins and ban them, they can also change what mods and gamemode is on the server as well.Another great thing is the event system. This allows you to create simple function with your bricks. So if you want to can have so when you click on a certain brick it disappears, or have a building explode when you step over a brick. The game also has bots that you can also event. This allows you to change their appearance, their weapon, if they are an ally or enemy, and much more. You can also apply lights to bricks and emitters which add smoke, grass, and different effects. This adds much more life to your builds and instead of just making a build for people to look at on a free build. You can create an adventure were people have to battle bots or have to collect keys to open doors.The minigame system is also amazing. With this system people can create their own game within the game. This allows them to select a playertype, select what weapons to start out with, etc. then invite people to join it. So people can be DMing on a free build of they want but this won't affect the people who didn't join the minigame. So you can have people fighting in a deathmatch, people racing, and people happily building all on the same server (the minigame system can be disabled if you want).The game also very moddible which keeps the game fresh. Installing a mod is very easy. Just put the zip into the adding folder, enable it in the custom game mode option and your done. There is also a mod called "return to blockland" which allows you to download mods ingame. The mods can be adding more vehicles, more events, different skyboxes, different bricks, basically anything. There is also a type of mod called a gamemode which packages a bunch of different addons into one and loads save and different gamemode options.The only real flaw of the game is that there aren't a big variety of servers up due to the community being so small. But the great thing is that you can create just about anything and it allows you to set up your own server without port forwarding so you can just create any type of server you want.I would recommend this game to anyone who likes building and Legos. Even to people who don't because there is such a large variety of things to do. This is the best building game I have played and puts other building games to shame.

content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												If you are not deeply into the building mechanics of this game stay far away from it. Its depends fully on mods and its community to be anything at all and what I encountered did no impress me at all but it might simply not be for me. Its a sandbox with a fair amount of tools but what you will most likely encounter if you go in blind will make you want to never touch the game again.It has a fairly simply list of achievements to introduce you to different parts of the game but has some really frustrating ones. One of them being for being on a server with 31 other people which is quite a rare thing and the more time that passes the harder it will become. When I got it there was only a single server close to those numbers, and I was only able to boost it high enough by asking friends with the game to join the server. But the most annoying achievement in the game goes to the race achievements. Its fairly simply as far as the idea goes; you need to complete an SP race and win a MP race on someone else's server...shouldnt be too bad if the driving mechanics was ok, but they are really bad. The driving is super floaty, and you can go of the track really easy forcing you to start all over.Time to 100%: 1-3 hours (depending on your luck)

Posted: March 15, 2014
												Honesty the worst $10 ive ever spent on steam. Ive spent hundreds of $$ on steam and have 90+ games, and this is by far the worst. The trailers depict what the game could be, had the developer actually update the game like hes supposed to. Updates havent come in a long time, and the best features and maps have been taken out. Its like a crappy version of Lego games. Bad graphics, laggy even when run with a powerful computer (i have an i7 4th gen 4700 processor and dual gtx 780s) and this is still laggy, which = server lag. Max of 50-60 people online total at any given time, split up in random servers so there is never enough on one to play. Too many trolls and little kids. Overall crappy game. DO NOT waste money on this. you will regret it. I uninstalled after 1 solid hour of playing just to give it a shot.

												the game is dead to me, this game is not blockland, its a poor mans minecraft, the community has turned to acid, and soon, to dust, the aspects of the game that made it fun in the good days, are gone, buried beneith the the vast layers of garbage, i bought this game, the non- steam version, 4 yrs ago, i had innocent, honest to god fun with other people, people just like me, who loved playing the game, because the game, back then, was good, it was fun, it was something to take my mind of of problems, and stress. it was a like a security blanket when i played it, i felt safe in the community, i felt happy in the community, i just loved the community, i am proud of being part of the old community, of being part of the old blockland, the one that you would spend hours playing, not to rack up your kills on a TDM server, but because you had FUN. the game is a shell of its former self, the part of my brain holding the memories, the few distant memories of the OLD blockland, is crying, and does so every time i play it. the new blackland can burn in hellRIPYe Olde BlocklandI will miss you.

YouTube™ Video: Definitely Not Minecraft: Blockland

content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												I have been playing this game for a few years, mainly indulging in it when I was far younger. The game still has some charm, and it will definitely benefit from being on steam, considering the community was a dying breed. All in all, it is like Roblox, only less Roblox. Though, that isn't to say the game isn't full of children (it is), and that the technical difficulties can be somewhat abbundant depending on the servers (depending on server work). Expect the few servers that have a lot of players to stay just that way, while the other few million remain dusty, and deserted. Only a handful of the servers will actually have players on them (as of 12/16/13, this could change with the introduction to steam). Oh, and there is a learning curve.If you can get past some of it's few shortcomings, it is worth it, as a fun minigame host.Oh, and the creator is still active, though barely.

												DIS♥♥♥♥♥♥IS SO ♥♥♥♥ING BADASS 666/10  SO GOOD KEKEKEKEKEKEKEKI thought i should write a proper review, now that this game is 10 years old.This is BLOCKLANDA game developed by Eric "Badspot" Hartman.It is a game similar to classic legos and building blocks.The game is full of Add-Ons, and almost every server has one.Another aspect is of course servers. Every server can be unique in a way, some have certain mods, while others do not.Now onto the 2 basic gamemodes; Custom: Enable any mods you want, and Freebuild: Build stuff.There are other gamemodes too, and more and more are being made by fellow Blocklanders.Time to conclude, I rate this game 9/10.It's a 9/10 because the game is basically dead, it's not being worked on by Badspot

content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												This game remains head of its class. There simply isn't another competitor. Go ahead and just try to find another good building game on steam that isn't autist minecraft sized bloxel garbage. Even LEGO's entry into this genre is *incredible* trash, and compared to their older building software, it's space-age technology. This, right here, is the only true brick building game.This game still gets patched but development is pretty much done. Disappointing, this game desperately needs better physics. Also, there's still no default helicopter. OR workshop support Other than that, you couldn't ask for a better sandbox game. This is a true 10/10. Worth every penny.

												The game itself is really good and fun, but the people who made the game are not enjoyable at all and the community has too many jerks in it. I have had this game since before it was a Steam game, it used to actually be better than it is now but the updates over time seem to have done more damage than good, but still the game itself is so much fun, it is the people who play and make it that are aweful. It is earily access so it has its downsides, but the community is not as bad (though there is no multiplayer yet) and they come out with updates that are actually good.For those commenting. content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
												Where do I begin? Blockland is a blocky style sandbox game, now I know what you're thinking, "Oh, it's just a stupid ROBLOX rip off!" But it's anything but that. In Blockland, you can do the traditonal free build mode, or you can do pirate death matches, search for treasure chests, race, and even more! The community has made many addons for this game, so you'll never get bored in it. This game is best enjoyed online, single player mode can be fun and all, but after a while you get sick of it. Over the years the game's community keeps shrinking and sadly this game is dying, but don't let that stop you from trying this game out, it's still a wonderful game you can easily enjoy, no matter how small the community becomes.

Posted: July 25, 2016
												I had this game for a long time and it died for me after 5 Months. After 1 Year, i visited the game once again and i Became instantly addicted once more. I still play it to this day and the blockland Player-base are very Welcoming and great. The only sad part is that this game's developers Stopped and now its only a Few 100 Players that are still here. Since there are little servers, Most players become Neighbors and you might find them in others Servers. My favorite Game Set is: City RPG. Roles, Personal Buildings, Banks, Sell Systems, Crime, Cops, Pickpocketing, Wanted levels, All amazing. I Definetley Recommend this game if you are a Fan of Humerous and/or Gmod Styled games.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												Pros: 5Tons of great addons such as: weapons, gamemodes, vehicles and more!Good servers now and then.Character customizationFun gamemodesHilarious bouncy physics in vehicles.Easy hosting. (For those that disagree dedication is a separate thing from hosting the server.)Cons: 4Community is often bad.Most servers are bad or empty.People tend to make click bait servers.Creator (BadSpot) has abandoned the game, thus it stopped getting updated.Overall, this a great game if you know where the proper place to look for servers and addons is. There's always a good server for me to play on, cool gamemodes to host! Large amount of addons for me to download. The vehicle physics can cause some funny moments. And there's even bots for when you wanna make single player dm's or NPC's in your Adventure gamemodes! I recommend this game to anyone who is up for a awesome mixed up gaming experience! Don't let the community get to you. If you can focus on what's in the game and not those playing the game, you'll will enjoy this game for sure!

content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												Pros: 5Tons of great addons such as: weapons, gamemodes, vehicles and more!Good servers now and then.Character customizationFun gamemodesHilarious bouncy physics in vehicles.Easy hosting. (For those that disagree dedication is a separate thing from hosting the server.)Cons: 4Community is often bad.Most servers are bad or empty.People tend to make click bait servers.Creator (BadSpot) has abandoned the game, thus it stopped getting updated.Overall, this a great game if you know where the proper place to look for servers and addons is. There's always a good server for me to play on, cool gamemodes to host! Large amount of addons for me to download. The vehicle physics can cause some funny moments. And there's even bots for when you wanna make single player dm's or NPC's in your Adventure gamemodes! I recommend this game to anyone who is up for a awesome mixed up gaming experience! Don't let the community get to you. If you can focus on what's in the game and not those playing the game, you'll will enjoy this game for sure!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												I'll admit it. I played ROBLOX when I got my computer back in 2010. Was ROBLOX awful? Yes. They turned a simple lego creativity game into a pay to play kind of game. Blockland, however, is not. Blockland uses all of the elements that ROBLOX has and multiplies the options by ten, with more controls, bricks, and ways to play. If you were to buy a Garry's Mod lego set, that would be Blockland. Lots of servers to choose from, many gamemodes (Even custom ones!), a community that is suprisingly adult-aged, and hours of fun. I would recommend this to anyone who loves LEGO's and Garry's Mod. It also has a weird physics engine, which adds to new exciting gameplay modes.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												When first opening (for macs) it asks what network type and mouse and keyboard options, when I choose the settings it says: Blockland cannot save your preferences. This can be caused by running the game from a read-only directory, mounted image or CD-ROM. Make sure you have copied the Blockand folder to your applications (which I did) and are running the game from there. Do not run the game directly from the dmg file. I've went online and sought answers from strangers on the interne, to no avail. Many people seem to have the some trouble and there doesn't seem to be a solution. Apart from that there are other bugs like not being able to see the face on the block person. Overall they seem like simple problems with quick solutions that have yet to be addressed by the developers and what not. So if you are a mac user, I would not recommend this game.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2016
												I ahve played this game since, well, probably since 2009. This game was going down hill then, but now it has really dropped. The server list was almost always full, filled with players, but now the servers are all empty and the best you can get is maybe a server filled with 10 people. I have 24.8 hours on my record, but overall I have played this for probably 200 hours. Most of the community stopped playing this game because maps were removed. A lot of people complained about it, but when I look back at it, maps did cause many problems. I still recomend this game if you just want to build things or if you want something to play with a few friends. I stopped playing in 2012 and came back in 2014, when this game was added to Steam, and I think it has restored the game's potential. Let's start a reboot of the community!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 9, 2014
												One of the best online builders i've seen. Compatible with MacOSx, Win XP - 8, and Linux. An actually decent community, AND ITS EASY TO MAKE YOUR OWN CONTENT. YES! You can download addons that don't require an IKEA instruction booklet, and make your own decals (textures) in a maximum time of 1 - 2 minutes. Best played with friends, the demo is just like the full game with a few restrictions. Other than unlimited building off the bat, You unfortunatly can't use addons, (it sucks i know, but hey! It's only $10:00), You can't play online, though you can play LAN if one person bought it. And for you people who have a life, LAN = Local Area Network, or in other words. you have to be in the same building as the other person. Overall, a great game. Big thanks to everyone to Eric Hartman, Kompressor, and everyone who contributed to/greenlit this game. Have Fun!

content:
Posted: February 13, 2016
 Blockland. A two-sided coin.  = Foreward = Okay, to start, blockland  by itself (By which I mean the game alone)  is by no means a bad game.It has it's pros and cons like any other game, but is mostly good.I will now describe this game through a  pros-cons paragraph (I know, overdone. But effective)! -=PROS=- + Building is fun, and has many possibilities. You just need creativity!+ Lots of bricks, vehicles, weapons and tools to use.+ Customizable characters (You get all hats, shirts etc., for free with the game)!+ Many, many add-ons, created by players which make the game 10 times better (They add and/or         adjust everything mentioned above).+ Has it's own "Dumbed down" version of scripting.+ Hosting and joining servers is very easy (Albeit, you may have to download the server's add-ons, if any) -=CONS=- - Community is absolutely cancer sometimes; stay away from the following types of servers:~Freebuild (With exceptions)~Family RP~FNAF RPI'm not kidding. A lot of the Blockland community is comprised of basement-dwelling man-babies. Stay. Away. From. These. Servers. - A bit glitchy sometimes.Overall ----  7/10 Very fun game. A NOTE TO PARENTS. If you want to buy your kid this game, go ahead, BUT.As I mentioned above, the people you may meet here do not act appropriately enough for young kids.I reccomend your son/daughter play alone, or on a private server with his/her friends.You have been warned. This community is very finnicky.  LINK TO BLOCKLAND FORUMS Be careful browsing here. Blockland Forums [forum.blockland.us] -- Find add-ons here. (Be careful about posting)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												I'll admit it. I played ROBLOX when I got my computer back in 2010. Was ROBLOX awful? Yes. They turned a simple lego creativity game into a pay to play kind of game. Blockland, however, is not. Blockland uses all of the elements that ROBLOX has and multiplies the options by ten, with more controls, bricks, and ways to play. If you were to buy a Garry's Mod lego set, that would be Blockland. Lots of servers to choose from, many gamemodes (Even custom ones!), a community that is suprisingly adult-aged, and hours of fun. I would recommend this to anyone who loves LEGO's and Garry's Mod. It also has a weird physics engine, which adds to new exciting gameplay modes.

												This game is pretty bad, I used to play it when I was younger and into roblox type games. What used to make this game really cool was the custom maps but the dev decided to remove them for some reason and you just have the boring gm_flatgrass-esque maps.The building system has always been really bad too. You have to move the blocks around with your keypad controls and place them one by one and it makes the building really annoying when you compare it to Minecraft or even something like Lego's digital designer tool.Get Minecraft instead, it's a much more fun and complete game.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2016
												Basics of the blockland experience: install the game log on Forget about changing from your default name Join a freebuild server. Get yelled at to change your name disconnect Change your name Join another  freebuild server. tell everybody that your new to the game and ask them to let you know if you do something wrong. Get banned with a reason saying "This server is protected by ANTI-N00B, Blocklands #1 anti noob software" Find out it wasnt software that banned you, it was a 9 year old. Join a differnt freebuild server Repeat step 7 Turns out everybody on the server is cool with noobs Get tought how to play the game by some really nice people Those people who tought you how to play the game turn out to become your life long friends Play on another server with your friends Build amazing things with your friends get your amazing things destroyed by another 9 year old admin whos jealous of your building skills You and your friends are extremely mad You and your friends team up and go on a massive trolling spree to get revenge on the 9 year old admin spam and break the rules for 3 hours get banned for a week you and the 9 year old are now enemys Play on another server The admin is a 4 year old little girl this time Your friend builds a really cool house that has scripted bots guarding it The 4 year old gets angry because she gets killed every time she walks past the house The 4 year old bans your friend You and your other friends get mad you and your other friends troll the *censored* out of the servers by duping d***s everywhere turns out the 4 year old had some 9 year old friends you and your friends get banned for a month congrats, you just made more enemys Host your own server  Host your own server invite all your friends all your friends join and you guys build some epic things All your enemys join All your enemys troll the *censored* out of your server Perma ban all of them and put a messgae in the reason section saying "Instead of using the temp bans, you should learn how to perma ban!" laugh your *censored* off. Make more friends make more enemys repeat steps 16 - 44To sum it up, In blockland, anything can happen, make friends, make enemys, build amazing things, make fun of people who make terrible things, be nice and helpful to people you like, troll the *censored* out of people you hate.10/10 Would make friends/enemys again. Dedicated to all the friends i made in blockland  Sir beefalo Magic Black Magic/StreetKingz (<<<< No relation to Magic.) Kronos/Blockland3357 SuperLuigi444 Va11jr. dedicated to all the ENEMYS i made in blockland   Boba Fett Laneer *ahem* I cant think of a number 3.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
												It's good. It's like multiplayer mods for Minecraft, but not as... well, let's be frank: rubbish. It's a block game where maps actually look like real things and not vague block representation of real things, and it has proper combat mechanics rather than Minecraft's, er, Minecraft. And it's very moddable without even needing any additional downloads.It's lacking polish and developer content though. It relies near-entirely on servers creating the gameplay and it's not set up well to make that easy. It's... hard to explain, but to simplify it, just about any mod is going to play perfectly functionally but look very unfinished. So it'd be really, really great if a proper professional team made a game like this!

content:
Posted: August 15, 2014
												I tried this out for a while and didn't enjoy it.  The controls for placing and orienting blocks are very clumsy, and to build anything above chest height you typically need to use the awkward jetpack.  It's very difficult to orient and snap things in place when you're trying to fly with the jetpack or balance on a wall while placing lego blocks, and I grew to hate the process.    Frankly, it's difficult and awkward even while standing still on ground level, and very time-consuming.  It's especially frustrating that you're limited to working with a single block at a time -- you can't grab a group of blocks and move them like you could with real blocks, and the tedium of aligning and placing each block with the really unreliable controls just sucked.After making a small room-sized building, I realized just how limited the blocks really are.  There's not a lot of interesting pieces, and it takes forever to work with even the pieces you're given to make anything.  Making even basic stuff takes an unreasonably long time because of the unreliable alignment and orientation (requiring very specific adjustments to camera angle with each block placed).  If you want to spend time creatively crafting a world, I recommend Minecraft instead as it's a lot more streamlined and there are a lot more block types and effects.  If you love legos, go buy some real ones, because this clumsy game just doesn't have the satisfying feeling of playing with legos in real life, and the process is so awkward and slow it will take you an unreasonably long time to do anything.The cart racing was mildly interesting for a round or two, but lag was crippling and the game became rapidly un-fun and un-playable, even on a low-lag server.  Once you fall into one of the many instant-death traps or pits, you have to sit and wait for the round to end (and lag usually makes sure you die sooner than later, but even without lag, the controls are terrible).  Also, you can't really do much with your cart -- building cool custom stuff on wheels just isn't available, and you apparently only get to select from pre-designed carts each round.  You appear to be able to make custom levels, and a few people have gone to the trouble, but the cart game itself is so clunky that the environments don't add much.  And most of the environments I saw were pretty boring and undetailed, which isn't surprising given the work it takes to do basic stuff.Frankly, I have trouble taking the preview images on the store page seriously.  To do that in minecraft would take a few hours; to do it in blockland would take a few weeks.  It makes me wonder if the people making those images used external tools to build the worlds, instead of the clunky in-game process.Last of all... the community is unpleasant.  There were a few nice people, but many people on multiplayer servers devote every second of their day to harassing other players, and this appeared to be actively encouraged.  They picked the most spammy, disruptive weapons and a victim and fired at him nonstop.  The super-spammer rocket launcher didn't destroy what I was trying to build, but it made progressing further impossible because my screen shook like crazy and the effects blinded me.  I felt that I was wasting my time playing on a server where someone can just hop on and start harassing me without reason, and it's not fun playing alone.  It takes too long to build anything, and you walk away feeling like the time you spent was wasted.  There are a lot of builder games out there, including early access stuff that's much more advanced than this (e.g. Space Engineers & Minecraft).Give this one a pass.  I wasted time trying it, I wasted friends' time trying it.  We all walked away disappointed and feeling cheated.  Ignore the pretty advertisement pictures; even if you had the patience to someday craft that with the bad controls and obnoxious griefers, you won't walk away satisfied or having enjoyed the process.  Game is not as advertised.

content:
Posted: February 13
												Blockland is one of my favourite PC exclusive games. It was pretty much the only game I owned on Steam back then that would run for me! Lets review it.Gameplay:Blockland has gave me 50 hours (and counting) of fun gameplay, in what seemed like so little time I had alreay indulged myself into the many servers that the game has (my favourite being the PvP) until at one point I decided, "Why should I keep playing OTHER peoples servers when I can make my own?" not only does this statement show that servers are hosted for free but it also shows that the community made me feel welcome so much I wanted to let them into MY places. So off I went! My natural instinct was to start some sort of RP server as I knew this would only mean basic building so I could slowly get to grips with the games controls and its compelling and complex "Event" system that allows players to code/link things up to other things that does things? As you see I haven't delved into that but I know you probably will! Graphics:Blockland has a very unique art style within the character and models area, essentially creating a virtual Lego experience! The option for shaders* is there and the latest patches automatically enables them if your graphics card supports it! Overall nice, rich textures and unique model style never seen before.Controls:Your basic Blockland controls consist of the regular WASD keys for movement and spacebar for jumping. It's all fair and well saying this but there IS a learning curve to this game (not a curve that will take ages to learn, just some basic memorising). The key curve to this game is the building mechanics, the building has its own keybinds! Hurray! Fortunately there isn't MILLIONS of keys that make the brick move 1cm of a brick however it does consist of the numpad section. For some people the thought of this could be quite daunting however I assure you that you will learn. Jetpack as well so thats awesome, right?Conclusion:As this review has got quite long I believe it may be time to wrap this up. So overall I'm going to rate this game 9.8/10! This is by far one of the most precise ratings yet for me however the 0.2 is just for the unfortunate loss of playerbase now - it appears to be steadily decreasing... Overall awesome game. Must have for any person who is a fond fan of Minecraft and/or other sandbox based games.I hope you enjoyed my review (if you read it that is)!*For those of you who don't know, shaders basically add shadows to the game and other visual effects that overall make the graphics look MUCH nicer.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 28
												WOW! It has been a while since I wrote one of these, and looking back on my past reviews that I wrote when I was just a dumb kid is baffling to me to this very day. But here I am! Reviewing Blockland because I have nothing better to do!So, where do I start? Well, let me start out by saying the game has very deep building mechanics and you can make some very impressive works of art if I do say so myself. I was able to make a very DooM inspired map where you explore, kill enimies, and unlock new guns and eventually, fight a final boss. Pretty cool? While I was building the level, I was also able to make a codex system that worked pretty well. Needless to say, the scripting system is easy to learn and use, not to mention you can do some impressive things with it.Combat is pretty okay, it's not the best thing, but it gets the job done. In the vanilla game you get a standard set of weapons; pistol, dual pistols, a sword, a rocket launcher, a spear, a bow and arrow, and a ray gun that turns any living entity into a horse (Is that even a weapon?).Sound design and graphics are simple, yet effective. Models are blocky, but stylized. Not sure what it is, but I kinda like the idea of my lego looking avatar having hands and feet that aren't attached to him and float there like he's some sort of offbrand Rayman. Not to mention the lighting and render system is pretty nice too! The shadow quality is actually really nice and a lot of the effects are well done! And if you don't want things to look like it's 1:00 PM all the time, you can adjust the time of day, the shadow colors, the way shadows effect certine blocks, add snow, rain, turn your map into a ocean or an ocean of lava, and more! But all of those things are for admin use only, but pretty useful when you're in singleplayer or hosting a server... or you're an adminBut that is all vanilla, and I'd be lying if I said there was no modding community; and HOLY♥♥♥♥♥♥ THAT IS A ♥♥♥♥ LOAD OF MODS! There is so many ways to teak and adjust the game it is paralyzing! You can add new guns, new blocks, new scripts, you can tweak the game and fix gameplay issues, etc, etc, etc. The modding community is pretty great, but some of the players can be pretty toxic at times, such as bad admins, or as I like to call them... Badmins. Once while I was in a roleplay server (Yes, I roleplay, I know I'm a damn nerd.) and I was kicked due to the two server owners saying I was being "OP" and they also told me in this in my ban message... AHEM!... "You don't know how to RP"... I don't know how to Roleplay, eh?... Alright, these guys were actually really bad roleplayers. Their grammar was bad, their charcters were bad (They were based off of Undertale characters and they were just bad OC's.) and they were pretty overpowered, but I can skim the OP part due to them being server admins, but they told me I was being OP. Funny part was, I was roleplaying as Doomguy. Not OP, but still pretty freakin' powerful! Not to mention he was totally rad! Anyway, I'm getting side-tracked.As a Sandbox game, I reccomend Blockland. I'm sure Blockland can give you a break from the normal Garry's Mod, and Minecraft, and ROBLOX that you see in todays world.

content:
Posted: March 21, 2014
												Blockland. Virtual legos. Sounds great right? On the surface it looks great, but in reality, its nothing as great as it looks. The trailer is a typical falsehood of what the game actually is. The best way I can describe it is a gilded turd. On the surface, it looks good, but once you get into it, you're left thinking "What the heck is this garbage?" A good game should not have the player stop and think "What am I doing? Why am I wasting my time with this?"Secondly, the server browser is absolutely terrible. The game modes and activites they show in the trailer are hard to come by. You will probably find 1 in 50 servers that holds your interest. Unless you have the attention span of a 6 year old, you wont find this entertaining. Which leads into my next point. The community.A game based off of virtual legos is obviously going to keep the interest of young, simple minded children rather than experienced gamers. The most mature thing you will come across in this game is a pathetic "Your mom" joke. Lets keep the legos as a child's toy, not a pathetic excuse for a video game. DO  NOT BUY THIS. Garry's Mod would be a much better investment. The community is mature, and the game-modes are more complete. Save your money.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												I have been a part of the Blockland community for a total of over 4 years and I can say that Blockland was one of the best 20 dollars (at the time) i have spent. I have met many players that I still keep in touch with daily today.Gameplay wise, it is an original experience that you won't find anywhere else. The game does NOT run like Minecraft at all, a generalization made by alot of players. The eventing system makes it easy to make your own gamemodes and advanced creations (from an MIDI synth to a Pong simulator to rainbow cars) and this title will be a hit between all fans of anything LEGO. Multiplayer is great too. It is very solid and I have come across minimal problems trying to play. If you really want to know what i'm talking about, give it a whirl. Especially now that it is on sale.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												Ignore my hours on Steam, I used to play this a lot before it was released onto this platform. This used to be a great game in 2008, back when the community was booming and there was thousands of add-ons. There was plenty of servers with a large number of players occupying them because of how broad and expansive this game was. Now though? Not so much. Every update that came out slowly made this game worse and worse. RTB got closed down, which rendered a lot of the great add-ons useless and boring, the game died off and now it's just a worthless library filler. I used to love playing this game all those years ago, now I don't even have the heart to load it up and wonder why I still have it installed. Just buy Garrys Mod instead if you don't already have it, if you have Garrys Mod do not and I mean DO NOT buy this game. All you will do is complain about how♥♥♥♥♥♥it is and claim it to be a GMod rip off.

content:
Posted: May 2, 2015
												Parents need to know that Blockland is an open-ended, exploration and creation focused environment. One of the best-selling, independently developed and published video games, Blockland's official release was in November 2011 following a lengthy beta test phase that attracted millions of players. Players can create items and buildings from scratch using materials they harvest from the world around them. There is no story, but players will encounter aggressive monsters they can fight using swords and bows. Graphics are extremely blocky, and there is no blood or gore, but the creatures can be a bit scary when they over sexually moan or appear seemingly out of nowhere to molest the players winky. Parents should note that this game has a thriving online community hosted by private, non-moderated servers. This means players could encounter offensive content in the form of profane text messages and suggestively shaped player-created structures, although players don't have to engage in online activity to enjoy the game. Thanks Notch!

content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												The hell have they done to my favorite game ever?I've clocked hundreds of hours into this game since before it's steam release, had it since about 2008. The community was alive, there were some great community made mods thanks to Return to Blockland (modding community, sorta like Steam Workshop), there was lots to do and lots of people to do it with. Now, it's dead... mods aren't as easy to find, and all the maps are FLAT! what happened to Bedroom? kitchen? all the classic maps that were fun as hell!? If the year was 2010, i'd tell you to buy this game because it's awesome... but it's 2015 and the game is completely ruined.Rating in 2010: 10/10Rating in 2015: 3/10

												This game...I just don't know what to say. You can do pretty much everything; play a uniqe shooter game, with guns that turn people into horses! Create some of the biggest things anyone's ever seen with your friends. Or you could just...you know...run around with a rocket launcher and destroy everything in sight. Infinite possibilities.The building machanic is pretty confusing, but it's very satisfying, for some odd reason. The wrench is the thing I use most often; I love scripting and making complex things!Overall, I love it, and definately reccommend this game to whoever likes building games with many possibilities!

content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
												whilst can be a fun sandbox game, this games building mechanics are frustrating, very complex and entirely non-noob friendly. about two years from buying this for two bucks I still find my self frustrated building a simple shack, and to get better tools you must go to the mod website and download a couple of tools that also need some explaining done.now that that is overwith, lets get on to multiplayer.you can find a decent amount of servers built by the community, some titled "Joni's TownRPG" or "Military RP" which the second one takes a heavy amount of addons and mods which shouldn't take long. anyway, the TownRPG mode is run by ten year olds who tower over you expecting you to do everything they say. shall you rebel against them and they spray a bunch of random incomprihensible blabber at you before banning you. if you do get farther than that you have to become a farmer and build a house, which takes more than a couple of hours and if you are lucky if they won't destroy it after you build it.atleast thats what happened in that server.Military RP is quite fun, atleast sometimes. you start off as a recruit, gather weapons and get in a vehicle and battle out in a decently large battlefield. fun sometimes yet not all the time.JailRP is another one where you are either a guard or a prisoner, obviously enough as a guard you guard and make sure the prisoners aren't doing anything too suspicous and as a prisoner you work together to escape, or take over the prison. if you know the secret areas there isn't much point in being a guard as prisoners will almost always win once the secret area is broken as they huddle in gathering akimbo pistols before killing each and every one of the guards.there are "parkour" servers which has a bunch of unfair platforms you miraclely have to jump on with a promising admin gift at the end.

content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												Blockland is a horror suvivor MMORPG game that is based on the Marvel universe. You start playing as Morgan Freeman right after he escaped Black Mesa when the cascade arrived. Now he has to fight to find his lost daughter. You will hear the line ''I will find you and I will kill you'' a lot this game as it is a metaphore for how he entered the Moonlight server on WoW. This game's soundtrack that is composed my Jesper Klyd is much better than COD's soundtrack will ever be and has ever been, hands down. The most important thing is to note is that the art design was made by the composers of Fruity loops the music software. The game also has a lot of fun that is not just the quests. The game is obviously Open-world Fallout-ish type of game where your choices matters just as much as it matters in Telltale games like back 2 the past. The game is not P2W because of daily quests. I give this game an Gaben/5.

number of helpful: 10 of 23 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
												A friend once asked me if this was another Minecraft knockoff. Here is my opinion on the matter.This game is nothing like minecraft. You do not have to build a house to survive the onslaught of monsters in the night (unless it is part of a special play mode, it has several modes), you don't dig into the ground. This game is far more similar to ROBLOX, a free to play mmo where you build whatever you want for the sake of building it and playing minigames with friends. In the sense that it has blocks and you can build things tho, yes, it is similar to Minecraft, except just like in ROBLOX you will build these things from choices in a menu, you do not collect materials as in Minecraft. Minecraft is about survival, mining and crafting. On the other hand it is unlike any other game specifically, because yes there are a lot of games with blocks with which you can build things out there, but that does not make them all a cheap ripoff of one another. This game is about hanging out and letting your imagination run free!I hope that clears it up a bit.

number of helpful: 10 of 23 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												I have been playing Blockland for the better part of my life, as cheesy as that sounds. In my opinion, it is a great game. The creativeness is very contemplating. I would rate this game five stars. Five stars without the Community. The community is horrid. Over the past few years the community has becoming worse and worse. Almost everyone are a bunch of screaming, crying kids. They are disrespectful, dishonorable, and terrible. Just take a look at it for yourself[forum.blockland.us]. There are a bunch of egotistical brats who spend a lot more of their time beating down people on the forums then playing the actual game themselves. It is near impossible to find a server that is full of good people who will teach you how to play the game and be nice to you. Most people are discriminate and will banish you from your server on sight.The game is great without the community, and I would rate it five stars in a heartbeat. But buying this game is quite testy since the major part of Blockland is it’s community. One bad apple can spoil the bunch, except the bunch are the bad apples. Looking behind the bad bunch are good people too. There are still a few people who are very creative, helpful, and kind. You may find a few friends too.I have more information about the game as well as a few interesting sites on a review I did on my blog. View it here.[blog.jakobjones.com]

												This is one of the most awful games I have ever played, If I had reviewed this in 2009, I would've said that I would reccomend it. They took out maps like the Bedroom, Kitchen, Artic, and flat groundless backgrounds as well, I can't start a freebuild server on single player, obviously a blalant copy of ROBLOX and Minecraft, not much people play the game anymore, the achievements are hidden, limited apparel and cosmetics, released from the times when !@#$ Mongler was a popular meme, abusive admins on every server I can go, does not support the Steam Workshop like a good game would. If you want to spend $10 on a game that you would enjoy, DO NOT BUY THIS! You'd be better off gifting your copy you own to some uncanny noob who has no idea how much you suffered when you bought this junk. If you want to buy this outdated game, you are wasting your money on garbage. Bottom Line: It sucks and the creators can go bankrupt for all we care. Sadly, nowadays, this game just sits in my library collecting dust.I'd still recommend it if you like these kinds of games. It may even grab your attention more than it did mine.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												I have played this game since 2012 (back when it wasn't on Steam) and had a decent experience. The game was fun and fresh, the community was decent, and the game was well updated. Unfortunately it seems in the past year the developer has given up on it, there's not much new content, the community is very hostile now, and the game has died. The game is dead.Let me be clear - I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME. Even if you do buy it I HIGHLY recommend avoiding the community.1) No new updates. The most recent update was back in December and was just a few bug fixes and tweaks. The developer only updates the game whenever there's a critical issue. I remember the game used to get all sorts of new updates to make it fresh and fun. Now it's an abandoned game waiting to die completely.2) Very, very hostile and rude community. There's this place called the Blockland Forums, don't go there. Ever. They yell, swear, argue at each other all the time and are very rude to new players who are just recently joining the forum. They have a board dedicated to drama in the community which causes 99% of the hostility in the community. I unfortunately have been a member of this forum for at least a year and regret it very much. Everyone there harassed me, hated me, and overall being on the forum made me a worse person.3) The game is dead. It's lost most of it's players when the developer stopped updating it which for someone like me makes the game really boring. I can't bother playing the game for more than half an hour before going and playing something else. The multiplayer servers are boring, no one makes cool stuff anymore, and if there is any good games no one is on them which makes those good games boring.I used to love this game. I'd play it everyday and was very good at it. Unfortunately times have changed and now the game is no good and just needs to die off.

												When I played ROBLOX, there were a bunch of stupid crappy games. Go to games tab, you see "Feed the Giant Spongebob to survive" or "Build a hamster". That game is falling apart. Along with all the 5 year olds, idiots, jerks, hackers, and bad administrators. This made me never touch my old Lego sets again since the game was based off of Legos. Then I found Blockland. I have to say buying it was one of the best choices I've ever made. It brought back my loving of Legos. A better variety of games, regular and mature gamers. This game is what ROBLOX used to be. If you want my opinion and you have or still do play that thing they call a game, BUY THIS!

												All though there are downsides to this game, like the lack of updates and the behaviour from some of the players. I love playing this game with my friends.If you do buy the game, it is recommended that you change your name and avatar first, players can be harsh to new players with a default name/avatar (blockheadBLID). If you're entirely new, try your own servers and screw around so you know what your doing on other people's.I have been playing since late v19 (before it was on steam) and I always loved to play it, Even though there are no more maps, you can still make a good out of it. For me odly, Blockland seems to work better on my OLD computers better than my newer ones (unless its a Duel core, then it works fine).I wouldn't recommend it for ages 1-10 as it's online interation has Drug Reference, Sexual themes, and lots of voilence/cursing.Bottom line, this game is recommended for the creative and adventerous user. (11+)

content:
Posted: January 26, 2015
												 Blockland is one of the best Lego games of all time. The game can make you build anything. Like a city, a ship, a landmark, anything you want. Thanks to the "Trust" system, there is no griefers online. You can't build or destroy other player's bricks unless you have grant trust (You have be on the menu and on the player list to give them trust). You can play with a friend or a lot of people in your server. This game made me stop playing Roblox and Minecraft due to its simple eventing and a better community. You can create a zombie game, a free build, a death match or a roleplay. Major downside is their might be bad servers but, the game is great. There is a mini-game system that you can make what ever game you wanted. Game is awesome. Go try it out.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2014
												one of the best games i have come accross yet! although 7 Days to die may have been a LAG MACHINE and sorta weak, this game let's you easily build, fight, and...well, grief! i built a HUGE map for dayZ and am going to get a dayz mod! also, those COD and CS fanz out there, keep your pants on. That segment's up next!Building... i'd give it a 8.5/10. It gives an... Accurate and detailed, Yet fast, way for building through "Ghost Blocks", and easily lets you make HUGE structures. This game had me addicted for 5 weeks... AND COUNTING! Now, for those Hyperactive, Spaztic no-scope, Quickscope, 720 Headshotters, ( lol yes, quick and no scope XD) here's the First Person Shooter portion!  This game adds a lil' indie, roblox, and quake in a way to say it! this is the mine-blox version of CS... i give it... a 9/10... mostly because you have to add on a mod to get more than a single gun in the game, but after all, it is a Kid's game. So. no gore, no...uhhm.. Guts..?And there ya go. That wraps it up with a rocketting score of.... {[( 17.5/20 )]}

number of helpful: 16 of 38 people (42%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
												A cross between minecraft and legos but without polish or enjoyment.  Trying to do the achievements is hard because the MP is nearly dead, and the kart experience is just horrible, with WASD controls and illogical physics.  I got this in a bundle for about a dime and I barely think I got my money's worth.The freebuild is like minecraft, but not as good, so why not just do minecraft?  I guess the legos (let's face it, they ripped off lego shapes) are more interesting to place than minecraft squares, but the UI isn't so easy to work with either.  All in all, it needs alot more work to be worth more than a bundle grab for <US$1

content:
Posted: June 19, 2016
Product received for free
Simply Boring,i just found it. . . boring. i was gifted this game by a friend, who insisted this was a great and fun game. so i accepted the gift and started playing. i joined a room with him, and instantly war bored, i expressed this and he told me "just learn the toutorial, you can then see what the game has in store! a whole one, poorly made, boring toutorial later. i still had no clue what this game was about, so i jumped into some mini games, which he insisted were amazing. and again, i didnt have a negitive experance, just a bored one. also to note: the controls were terrible and confusing, for example, left click is "ghost" a block (see where you are putting the block) and numpad enter, is to actually place it. so i have to use my mouse hand to press "place" to actually build things. i feel like this game could entertain different types of people, and that person is not me. maybe my friend can give the copy i gave back to him to a 7 year old who is too poor to run lego worlds. if i did have to give it a 1 - 10 rating, it would be a 2/10.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
												Blockland Review - Raymond K. Turcotte - *Update* (Again) ( I origanaly said this was a "Minecraft Ripoff" This is a message to those who replied in a negative way) I really find some people on Steam are takeing my Review the wrong way. So what if my opinion isn't the same as yours? I'm not going to become a Conformist just because everyone else thinks it's a master peice. Again. This game i'd recommend to 6 or 7 year old. Because it's like a Lego game. Actually when i put it that way. It's a Lego "Ripoff"I decided to make a List of Pros and ConsPROS: The Few advantages of playing Minecraft, Blockland and others like it is it prepares you for life.  The obvious one is carpentry, building houses, underground lairs, whatever. You eventually develop skills that could be useful.  Another note is it's life itself. You chat with people online. You don't trust the nearby nood who you just met with a one of your guns, will you? No, obviously not. Players will develop trust issues with other players online. Just like in the real world. The players will develop friendships as well, because the players avatars are in form of human. It's life.CONS: It's just like the leading competitor and very popular game "Minecraft" or/and basically copying the whole concept from an all time popular toy game "Lego" So remember when you play this game. They copied/Stole the idea from someone else. Players could be nasty with one another online. Throwing violent words at each other, It's supposed to be a child's game! No violence. (Swear words) It's because of these game were children develop "Bad attitudes" and/or "Bad languages "Because of the Adults/Teenagers who play these games and get angry.  When people wonder on "why children these days are so mean," Think about this game!I keep my point stable I don't recommened this Game!!!!

												This game is just.. I just dont like it. I cant play it cause 1 , it has block graphics, It really should be improved, ive seen games that are amazing, and another thing, this game has no lands, you have too create it all on your own, I would like the game too have something fun to do besides build. I know my time is 4.5 hours on record but thats cause i TRIED too play it, i liked it for the first 5 minutes and got bored of it, I wish there was crafting and stuff like that, And i know it says it has freedom too design but its a bit too much freedom, it feels boring when someone does this sort of thing. It was good for 5 minutes, then i quit, Just does not have any great stuff too look forward too and may i add, they havent done a patch since 2014, and its almost 2016 now. So please do not buy this game if you want multiple patches every so often.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.
